home.title: Frontmatter Editor
home.subtitle: Edit and manage your markdown frontmatter
home.description: A powerful tool for editing markdown file frontmatter
home.getStarted: Select your articles folder to get started
home.fileTreeInstruction: The tree icon on the left is the file list, click to view and edit file content.
home.exportInstruction: The export button can export all files to XLSX format or import all files' frontmatter from XLSX.
home.editInstruction: The edit button can batch edit frontmatter fields.
home.settingsInstruction: The settings button can configure some options, such as language.
home.saveInstruction: The save button can save all modified files to the file system.
home.loadingMessage: Please wait a moment, the file list is being prepared.

files.defaultName: This is the tree view interface
files.defaultDescription: You can edit the frontmatter of specified documents on this page. Select a file from the left to start.

batchEdit.title: Batch Edit Workspace
batchEdit.loadingContent: Reading and parsing frontmatter of all files
batchEdit.loadingDescription: This process is done in parallel and usually doesn't take too long. If you have many files, it may take several minutes.
batchEdit.fileRegexLabel: Regular expression pattern for files to operate on (default for Markdown files):
batchEdit.fieldNameLabel: Field name(s) to add, remove or normalize, separated by commas if multiple (e.g.: title, author):
batchEdit.fillFieldsError: Please fill in the field name, file regex and target value
batchEdit.backupConfirm: You are performing a batch edit operation, which may cause serious consequences if done incorrectly. Although your operations will not be immediately written to the file system, it is recommended to backup the current frontmatter to prevent difficulty in recovery after incorrect editing
